tenebro: <entryFree id="n47764" type="main" key="te^ne_^bro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnē^bro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to darken</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vesperā semitam tenebrante,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 208, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tenebrose: <entryFree id="n47765" type="main" key="te^ne_^bro_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnē^brōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tenebrosus <sense id="n47765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tenebrosus: <entryFree id="n47766" type="main" key="te^ne_^bro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnē^brōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tenebrae</etym>, <cb n="TENE" /> <sense id="n47766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gloomy</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n47766.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëra dimovit tenebrosum et dispu lit umbras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:839" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 839</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tartara,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:359" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specus tenebroso caecus hiatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:409" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">balnea Grylli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:60:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 60, 3</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:14:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 14, 13</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">caeruleo tenebrosa situ,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:400" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 400</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 329</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carcer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 1</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin. — Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnē^brōsum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the dark</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 4, 12</bibl>; and <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tenebrosis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Thren. 3, 6</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47766.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebrosissimus error,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 6, 43, 3 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> — * <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕ-nē^brōsē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">darkly</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ion. 4, 6</bibl> (with occulte).</sense></entryFree>
tenedos: <entryFree id="n47767" type="main" key="Te^ne^dos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕnĕdos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*te/nedos,</foreign> <sense id="n47767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a celebrated island in the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">off the coast of Troas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">named after king</hi> Tenes or Tennes (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*te/nnhs</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">who received divine honors;</hi> still called <hi rend="ital">Tenedos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 39, § 140</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:19:section=49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 19, § 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Arch. 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 15, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:21 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 21 al.</bibl>—Also <hi rend="ital">the name of the capital of this island</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 109</bibl>. — Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕnĕ-dĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tenedos</hi>: Tenediā securi, <hi rend="ital">according to the strict justice of king Tenes</hi>, prov., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 11, 2</bibl>; M. Aurel. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 1:9" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 1, 9</bibl>. —In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕnĕdii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tenedos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:15:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 15, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tenellulus: <entryFree id="n47768" type="main" key="te^nellu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnellŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n47768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [tenellus], <hi rend="ital">somewhat tender</hi> or <hi rend="ital">delicate</hi> (perh. only in the two following passages): <cit><quote lang="la">puella tenellulo delicatior haedo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 15</bibl></cit>: manu lascivulā et tenellulā, Laev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 903</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
tenellus: <entryFree id="n47769" type="main" key="te^nellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnellus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n47769.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [tener], <hi rend="ital">somewhat tender</hi> or <hi rend="ital">delicate</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">bella et tenella Casina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: vates, Domit. Mart. poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungulae pullorum equinorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:5:86" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 5, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenellum enim cito facit putre (aqua),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:41:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 41, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
teneo: <entryFree id="n47770" type="main" key="te^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnĕo</orth>, <itype>tĕnŭi, tentum, 2</itype> (<sense id="n47770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> tetinerim, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 178, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tetinerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:ib. 178:12" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> ib. 178, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tetinisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:ib. 178:11" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> ib. 178, 11</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">fut. perf.</hi> tetinero, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=252" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 252</bibl> Müll. Another collat. form of the <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> tenivi, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 220</bibl> P.; Diom. pp. 363 and 369 ib.), <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root ten-, tan-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ta/numai, tei/nw;</foreign> Sanscr. tanomi, to stretch, spread; this root appears in many derived meanings; cf. Lat.: tendo, tenuis, tener, tenor, tenus</etym>. </sense><sense id="n47770.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have</hi> in the hand, in the mouth, etc. </sense><sense id="n47770.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47770.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <hi rend="ital">Eu.</hi> Porrige bracchium, prehende: jam tenes? <hi rend="ital">Cha.</hi> Teneo. <hi rend="ital">Eu.</hi> Tene, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 42</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum pyxidem teneret in manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:26:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 26, 63</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: aliquid manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:560" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 560</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:320" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 320</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid dextrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:99" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 9, 86</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 522</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 100</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">radicem ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:68:141" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 68, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: decoctum diu in ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 105, § 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in sinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 3, 114</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: aliquem sinu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:157" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flabellulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 19</bibl></cit>. — Prov.: manu tenere aliquid, <hi rend="ital">to seize</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grasp</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">comprehend a thing</hi> which is palpable or evident: aliter leges, aliter philosophi tollunt astutias: leges, quātenus manu tenere possunt; <cit><quote lang="la">philosophi, quātenus ratione et intellegentiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:68" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 17, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum res non conjecturā, sed oculis ac manibus teneretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 7, 20</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47770.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47770.5" n="a" level="4"> With the accessory idea of possession, <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to be master of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have in one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s power</hi>, <hi rend="ital">possess</hi>, etc. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">possideo, habeo): multa hereditatibus, multa emptionibus, multa dotibus tenebantur sine injuriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 23, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae tenuit dives Achaemenes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:12:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 12, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Evander qui multis ante tempestatibus tenuerat loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provinciam a praedonibus liberam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles praesidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Formiarum moenia et Lirim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenente Caesare terras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:39:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 39, 83</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:19:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 19, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">summam imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitum centurias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum cornu,</quote> <trans><tr>to command</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincias aliaque omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 39, 2</bibl></cit>: scenam, <hi rend="ital">to have sole possession of.</hi> <pb n="1854" /> <cb n="TENE" /> <hi rend="ital">rule over</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 7</bibl>. — <cit><quote lang="la">Of the possession of the object of affection: te tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:6:35" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 6, 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:52" default="NO">2, 6, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 103</bibl> Ruhnk.; 15, 88; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 2, 4</bibl>.—In colloq. lang., teneo te, <hi rend="ital">I have you once more</hi>, of again seeing the beloved person: <cit><quote lang="la">teneone te, Antiphila, maxime animo exoptata meo?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 4, 27</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 183</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et comitem Aenean juxta natumque tenebat Ingrediens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 308</bibl></cit>.—Also like our <hi rend="ital">I have you</hi> (fast, bound, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">teneo te, inquam, nam ista Academiae est propria sententia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 48, 148</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 20, 63</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: qui tenent (sc. rem publicam), <hi rend="ital">who are in possession of the State</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of public affairs</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tenent, qui potiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 18, 1</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47770.6" n="b" level="4"> With the accessory idea of firmness, persistence, <hi rend="ital">to hold fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupy; to watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defend; to maintain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retain</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">legio locum non tenuit atque in proximum collem se recepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec noctu firmis praesidiis tenebantur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capitolia celsa tenebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo teneam Protea nodo?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te neque intra Claustra tenebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:11:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 11, 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in manicis et Compedibus saevo te sub custode tenebo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 77</bibl></cit>: laqueis (se) sensit teneri ... fugam frustra tentabat; <cit><quote lang="la">at illam Lenta tenet radix exsultantemque coërcet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:74 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 74 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 535</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenae tuae sempiternam in arce oleam tenere potuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri qui diu aquam tenent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Apr. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem ibi tenebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:46:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 46, 8</bibl></cit>: secundissimo vento cursum tenere, <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keep one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s course</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:34:83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 34, 83</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vento intermisso cursum non tenuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 28</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cursum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:21:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 21, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 370</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:16:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 16, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(lunam) fingunt cursus viam sub sole tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:714" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 714</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuit tamen vestigia Bucar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:32:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 32, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47770.7" n="c" level="4"> With the accessory idea of reaching the object aimed at, <hi rend="ital">to reach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attain</hi> a place: <cit><quote lang="la">montes effuso cursu Sabini petebant et pauci tenuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 37, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 25, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 16, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 13, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">26, 29, 4: Hesperiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:498" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 18, 198</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quibus (navibus) Cythnum insulam tenuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47770.8" n="d" level="4"> With the accessory idea of movement impeded, <hi rend="ital">to hold fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">check</hi>, <hi rend="ital">control</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">naves, quae vento tenebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid hic agatur, scire poteris ex eo, qui litteras attulit, quem diutius tenui, quia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si id te non tenet, advola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 16, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septimum jam diem Corcyrae tenebamur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 7</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marcellum ab gerundis rebus valetudo adversa Nolae tenuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 20, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tenebo te pluribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne diutius teneam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:13:section=34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 13, § 34</bibl></cit>: solutum (corpus) tenere, Cels. praef. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ventrem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 19 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tene linguam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:602" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 602</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus omne tenendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:371" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 371</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix a te videor posse tenere manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 203</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">manum stomachumque teneto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeva tene cum Berecyntio Cornu tympana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:18:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 18, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et Phoebi tenuere viam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>impeded</tr>, <tr>closed up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo me decet usque teneri?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 39</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas in morte miserā non tenebamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:67:section=172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 67, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictator exercitum in stativis tenebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 14, 1</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47770.9" n="(b)" level="5"> Esp.: se tenere, <hi rend="ital">to keep back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinus castris sese tenebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā clade acceptā castris se pavidus tenebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hasdrubal procul ab hoste intervallo tenebat se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se domi a conventu remotum tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 9:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego tamen teneo ab accusando vix me hercule: sed tamen teneo,</quote> <trans><tr>restrain myself</tr>, <tr>refrain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec se tenuit, quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 4, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mid.: teneri non potui, quin tibi apertius illud idem his litteris declararem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 14, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:7:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 7, 10</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se intra silentium tenuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:17:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 17, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum me intra silentium tenui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 7:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 6, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47770.10" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47770.11" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contain</hi> in the mind, <hi rend="ital">to conceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprehend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">know</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">percipio, intellego): nunc ego teneo, nunc scio, Quid sit hoc negotii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 39</bibl></cit>: tenes Quorsum haec <cb n="TENE" /> tendant quae loquor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenes, quid dicam?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneo,</quote> <trans><tr>I understand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 1, 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneo quid erret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:23:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 23, 37</bibl>; cf.: quibus capiatur Caesar, tenes, Caecin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 7, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae a Romanis auguribus ignorantur, a Cilicibus ... Lyciis tenentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:15:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 15, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam ea, quae tenebatis ipsi, etiam ex me audire voluistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:46:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 46, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus reconditos sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo pacto cuncta tenerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et teneo melius ista,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:37:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 37, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullus frugi esse homo potest, nisi qui et bene facere et male tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 647</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47770.12" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47770.13" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To have possession of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">have the mastery of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to control</hi> any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">cum rem publicam opes paucorum non virtutes tenere coeperunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:34:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 34, 51</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47770.14" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To hold fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guard</hi>, <hi rend="ital">preserve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uphold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insist</hi> (syn. servo): <cit><quote lang="la">sin consuetudinem meam, quam in re publicā semper habui, tenuero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">portum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:28:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 28, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tenebat ornatum suum civitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si jus suum populi teneant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 32, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec diutius umquam tenetur idem rei publicae modus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est boni viri, haec duo tenere in amicitiā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:18:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 18, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:10:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 10, 44</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 408</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 15, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebat non modo auctoritatem, sed etiam imperium in suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47770.15" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To hold fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">defend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uphold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insist</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud arcte tenent accurateque defendunt, voluptatem esse summum bonum,</quote> <trans><tr>hold fast</tr>, <tr>maintain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:1:3:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 1, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">illud, quod multos annos tenuisset,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 22, 71</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quod idem Peripatetici non tenent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:13:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propositum tenere,</quote> <trans><tr>to maintain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 42, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suas leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam apud centumviros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:24:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 24, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo causae teste tenentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum quendam cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:21:81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 21, 81</bibl></cit>.— With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs tenuit, ne consules in proximum annum crearentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:30:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 30, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid ferretur ad populum, patres tenuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 29, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 19, 7</bibl>. — With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuere patres, ut Fabius consul crearetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 42, 2</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">scripseram tenuisse Varenum ut sibi evocare testes liceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 5, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47770.16" n="d" level="4"> Of memory: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus memoriam cum summā benevolentiā tenere,</quote> <trans><tr>to recollect</tr>, <tr>preserve a recollection of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 2, 1</bibl></cit>.—Esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriā tenere: memoriā tenetis, compluris in Capitolio res de caelo esse percussas,</quote> <trans><tr>you remember</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriā teneo, C. Sulpicium Gallum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 14, 21</bibl></cit>; v. memoria; so without memoria, <hi rend="ital">to bear in mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remember</hi>, <hi rend="ital">recollect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">satin' haec meministi et tenes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numeros memini, si verba tenerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 336</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem (Cyrum) omnia militum tenuisse creditum est nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:45" default="NO">11, 2, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47770.17" n="e" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To reach</hi> an object striven after, <hi rend="ital">to gain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acquire</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obtain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attain</hi> (syn. assequor): <cit><quote lang="la">per cursum rectum regnum tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:17:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 17, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Servium Tullium post hunc captivā natum, ingenio virtute regnum tenuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneri res aliter non potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa tenuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 190</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47770.18" n="f" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repress</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fetter</hi>, etc. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">refreno, retineo): iracundiam teneat, avaritiam coërceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:5:1:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 5, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:1:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:80:278" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 80, 278</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">risum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Vatin. 8, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:2:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae occurrant, tenere,</quote> <trans><tr>to hold back</tr>, <tr>keep to themselves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:54:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 54, 221</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47770.19" n="g" level="4"> Of laws, etc., <hi rend="ital">to bind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">obligate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be binding on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">control</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam leges eum non tenent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">interdicto non teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:14:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 14, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voto quodam et promisso teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut plebi scita omnes Quirites tenerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 12, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">olim patricii dicebant se plebi scitis non teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum velut in controverso jure esset, tenerenturne patres plebi scitis, legem tulere, ut quod tributim plebis jussisset, populum teneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 55, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneri alienis foederibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 29, 11</bibl></cit>: poenā teneri, <hi rend="ital">to be subject</hi> or <hi rend="ital">liable to</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">testibus in re perspicuā teneri,</quote> <trans><tr>to be convicted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: nemo <cb n="TENE" /> ita in manifesto peccatu tenebatur, ut, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:78:section=191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 78, § 191</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedis teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneri repetundarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:11" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 47, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:1:10" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 17, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi illi ipsi, qui eas (libidines) frangere deberent, cupiditatis ejusdem tenerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:13:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 13, 31</bibl></cit> Mos. and Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n47770.20" n="h" level="4"> Of dispositions, desires, etc., <hi rend="ital">to possess</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">control</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae te tanta pravitas mentis tenuerit, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>has had possession of you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summum me eorum (librorum) studium tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 11, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna me spes tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:97" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de triumpho nulla me cupiditas umquam tenuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si consilio pulso libidines iracundiaeve tenerent omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi forte quem inhonesta et perniciosa libido tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: neque irā neque gratiā teneri, <hi rend="ital">to be controlled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">influenced</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:17:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 17, 45</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">teneri desiderio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studio philosophiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno amore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 675</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pompā, ludis atque ejusmodi spectaculis teneri,</quote> <trans><tr>to be enchained, fascinated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:18:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 18, 48</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut oculi picturā teneantur, aures cantibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is qui audit, ab oratore jam obsessus est ac tenetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:62:210" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 62, 210</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 146</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n47770.21" n="k" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To take in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprehend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">include</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec magnos formula reges, Excepto sapiente, tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 46</bibl></cit>.—More freq. <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: teneri aliquā re, <hi rend="ital">to be contained</hi>, <hi rend="ital">comprised</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grounded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to consist in</hi> a thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ut homines deorum agnatione et gente teneantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod (genus officiorum) teneatur hominum societate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:45:160" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 45, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (causae) familiaritate et consuetudine tenentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixi jam antea, ipsam rationem arandi spe magis et jucunditate quadam quam fructu atque emolumento teneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:98:section=227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 98, § 227</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n47770.22" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> (freq. after the Aug. per.; perh. not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n47770.23" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47770.24" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To hold a position</hi> anywhere, <hi rend="ital">maintain one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā abscisae rupes erant, statio paucorum armatorum tenebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo extra ordinem milia tenuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:62:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 62, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenent Danai, quā deficit ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:505" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 505</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47770.25" n="2" level="3"> For cursum tenere, <hi rend="ital">to hold</hi> or <hi rend="ital">take one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sail</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steer</hi> in any direction: <cit><quote lang="la">Aeneam ... ab Siciliā classe ad Laurentem agrum tenuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cassandream petentes, primo ad Mendin tenuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:45:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 45, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad Mendaeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:49:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 49, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Diam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 690</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Creten,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:706" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 706</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hesperiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:498" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 1, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ausoniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:290" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 290</bibl></cit> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">medio tutissimus ibis ... Inter utrumque tene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 140</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47770.26" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, with the accessory idea of continuance (cf. I. A. 2. b. and B. 2. b. supra), <hi rend="ital">to hold out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">last</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maintain itself</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevail</hi>, etc. (cf. obtineo): <cit><quote lang="la">imber per noctem totam tenuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:44:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 44, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">incendium per duas noctes ac diem unum tenuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:47:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 47, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per aliquot dies ea consultatio tenuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:47:6" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 47, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenet fama, lupam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod nunc quoque tenet nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama tenuit, haud plus fuisse modio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:46:10" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 46, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuit consuetudo, quae cottidie magis invalescit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit> Spald.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen illud tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 47</bibl></cit> Spald.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 712</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tener: <entryFree id="n47771" type="main" key="te^ner"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕner</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>v. teneo; cf. tenuis, and Sanscr. tanu</etym>, <sense id="n47771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tender</hi> (class.; cf. mollis). </sense><sense id="n47771.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47771.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est tam tenerum, neque tam flexibile neque quod tam facile sequatur quocumque ducas quam oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:45:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 45, 176</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:274" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 79, 274</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and v. II. infra): locus bipalio subactus siet beneque terra tenera siet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 45, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">serito in loco, ubi terra tenerrima erit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 151, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tenero corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:765" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 765</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procera et tenera palma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices harundinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneris arboribus incisis atque inflexis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cana legam tenerā lanugine mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caules,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 359</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prata tenerrima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër,</quote> <trans><tr>thin</tr>, <tr>transparent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 145</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:699" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 699</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 616</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallina,</quote> <trans><tr>tender</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ferae tenuiores ad epulas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:15:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dianam tenerae dicite virgines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 21, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">virgines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conjux,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 26</bibl></cit> <pb n="1855" /> <cb n="TENO" /> Lycidas, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltatores,</quote> <trans><tr>effeminate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestem Purpuream teneris quoque Maecenatibus aptam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:39" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spado,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47771.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">of tender age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">young</hi>: tener ipse etiam atque puellus, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 697</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">tener et rudis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:17:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 17, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tener in cunis et sine voce puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:6:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(annus) tener et lactens puerique simillimus aevo Vere novo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equis vetulis teneros anteponere solemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haedus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:491" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 491</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manes,</quote> <trans><tr>the shades of children</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:121" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 121</bibl></cit>.—Of plants, tenerae res, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 343</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneri anni,</quote> <trans><tr>youthful</tr>, <tr>tender</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:15:1" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 15, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">teneriores anni (opp. ferociores),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a teneris, ut Graeci dicunt, unguiculis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from childhood</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: de tenero ungui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 24</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">a tenero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (plantae) eam partem caeli spectent, cui ab tenero consueverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:20" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 20</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnĕri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the young</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boys</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcendum est teneris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:215" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 215</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 59</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: in teneris,</quote> <trans><tr>in early youth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 272</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 3, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47771.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47771.5" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">soft</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tender</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">est naturale in animis tenerum quiddam atque molle,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:6:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus est in amicitia tenera atque tractabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 13, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenerior animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 21, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tenerae Mentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 52</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 4, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est oratio mollis et tenera et ita flexibilis, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:52" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 16, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 9, 38</bibl>; cf. I. supra <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 246</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 273</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of elegiac poets: <cit><quote lang="la">poëta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 35, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 757</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Propertius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molli tenerāque voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenera delicataque modulandi voluptas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 31</bibl></cit> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n47771.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of youthful weakness, <hi rend="ital">tender</hi>: tener animus (pueri), Anton. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 13</bibl>, A, 3; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">horum erroribus teneri statim et rudes animi imbuuntur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 29</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc mentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">tenderly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delicately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">softly.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47771.7" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnĕrē</orth> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:44:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 44, 20</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">complosit manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 24</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">derasus cortex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 3, 35, § 72</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47771.8" n="b" level="4"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnĕrĭter</orth>, only once cited: <cit><quote lang="la">teneriter quidam efferunt, ut celeriter: alii vero tenere ut libere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 162</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
tenerasco: <entryFree id="n47772" type="hapax" key="te^ne^rasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnĕrasco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n47772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [tener], <hi rend="ital">to grow tender</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:765" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 765</bibl>; cf. teneresco.</sense></entryFree>
tenere: <entryFree id="n47773" type="main" key="te^ne^re_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnĕrē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tener <sense id="n47773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
teneresco: <entryFree id="n47774" type="main" key="te^ne^resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnĕresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n47774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [tener], <hi rend="ital">to grow soft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tender</hi> (post-Aug., but tenerasco with Lucr.): <cit><quote lang="la">in tantum tenerescere acinos, ut rumpantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 189</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:183" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 12, 50, § 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Res. Carn. 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
teneritas: <entryFree id="n47775" type="main" key="te^ne^ri^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnĕrĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">softness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tenderness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47775.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 24, 29, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brassicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 8, 41, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemmae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 7, 28, § 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus jecori teneritas nulla praefertur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 42, 67, § 143</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47775.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: in primo ortu (rerum) inest teneritas et mollities quaedam, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:21:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 21, 58</bibl> aetatis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneritas Corinthiorum (opp. severus mos Doricorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
teneriter: <entryFree id="n47776" type="gloss" key="te^ne^ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnĕrĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tener <sense id="n47776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
teneritudo: <entryFree id="n47777" type="main" key="te^ne^ri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnĕrĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tener</etym>, <sense id="n47777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">softness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tenderness</hi> si terra teneritudinem habet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:36" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 36</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">casei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mai, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corticis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Jan. 15, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri primae teneritudinis,</quote> <trans><tr>of the tenderest age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:44" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tenerositas: <entryFree id="n47778" type="main" key="te^ne^ro_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnĕrōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tender age</hi>, Ven Vit S. Men. 2.</sense></entryFree>
tenes: <entryFree id="n47779" type="main" key="Te^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕnes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v Tenedos.</entryFree>
tenesmos: <entryFree id="n47780" type="greek" key="te_nesmos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tēnesmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">teinesmo/s,</foreign> <sense id="n47780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a straining at stool</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tenesmus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 14, 59, § 211</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:54" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 6, 23, § 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:227" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 21, 84, § 227</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 142" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 142</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 18</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
tenitae: <entryFree id="n47781" type="gloss" key="Te^ni^tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tĕnĭtae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: <sense id="n47781.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Tenitae credebantur esse sortium deae, dictae quod tenendi haberent potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=368" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 368</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
tenor: <entryFree id="n47782" type="main" key="te^nor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>teneo, II. B.</etym>, <sense id="n47782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a holding on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">holding fast;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">an uninterrupted course</hi>, <hi rend="ital">career</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tenor</hi> (mostly post-Aug.; cf.: cursus, ordo). </sense><sense id="n47782.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: hasta fugit servatque<cb n="TENT" />  cruenta tenorem, <hi rend="ital">keeps its course</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:340" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 340</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(aulaea) placido educta tenore Tota patent,</quote> <trans><tr>by a steady motion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic tibi versandus tenor est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:729" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 729</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrumpere tenorem rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:38:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 38, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenorem pugnae servabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenor vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 12, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eundem tenorem servare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 2:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unus tenor algoris aestūsve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem tenore duo insequentes consulatus gessi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:40:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 40, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eodem consiliorum tenore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno et perpetuo tenore juris semper usurpato, numquam intermisso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 16</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">austeritatis (in smaragdis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenorem in narrationibus servant,</quote> <trans><tr>connection</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum quantum, quale interrogantes gravi, comparantes acuto tenore concludunt,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>tone</tr>, <tr>accent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc difficilior observatio est per tenores vel accentus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">§ 26: vel heroos gressu truncare tenores,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>mingle pentameters with heroic verses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:99" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 99</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47782.2" n="B" level="2"> Adverb.: uno tenore, <hi rend="ital">in one course</hi> or <hi rend="ital">direction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uninterruptedly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">uniformly</hi>: isque (stilus medius) uno tenore, ut aiunt, in dicendo fluit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:6:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 6, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevis profecto res est, si uno tenore peragitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 5, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uno tenore fidem colere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:37:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 37, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenore uno in mediam aciem illati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:47:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 47, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hi mores eaque caritas patriae per omnes ordines velut tenore uno pertinebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:49:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 49, 3</bibl></cit>: so, <cit><quote lang="la">uno velut tenore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 42, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47782.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., in the later jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">the connection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contents</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tenor</hi> of a law: <cit><quote lang="la">pro tenore legis Aquiliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:56" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro tenore S C Claudiani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 2, 21, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctorum verba emendare tenore sententiae perseverante, non est prohibitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:1:46" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 1, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tenos: <entryFree id="n47783" type="main" key="Te_nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tēnos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-us</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*th=nos,</foreign> <sense id="n47783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Cyclades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Andros and Delos</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Tino</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 22, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 469</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tensa: <entryFree id="n47784" type="main" key="tensa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tensa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n47784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chariot</hi> or <hi rend="ital">car on which the images of the gods were borne in the Circensian games.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47784.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tensam ait vocari Sinnius Capito vehiculum, quo exuviae deorum ludicris Circensibus in Circum ad pulvinar vehuntur. Fuit et ex ebore, ut apud Titinnium in Barbato, et ex argento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=364" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 364</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: tensa <foreign lang="greek">a(/rma qew=n,</foreign> Gloss.
