Philox.: <cit><quote lang="la">via tensarum atque pompae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:59:section=154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 59, § 154</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 3, § 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 5, 72, § 186</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tensam ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 41, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40:16" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 40, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 35, 12</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n47784.2" n="II" level="1"> Perh. for <hi rend="ital">a carriage</hi> in gen.: vende tensam atque mulos: sine eam pedibus grassari, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 316, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tensio: <entryFree id="n47785" type="main" key="tensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tendo</etym>, <sense id="n47785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stretching</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stretching out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extension</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare). </sense><sense id="n47785.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: papilionum, <hi rend="ital">a setting up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pitching</hi>, Hyg. Gromat. <hi rend="ital">init.— Plur.</hi>: bracchia, quae in eas tensiones includuntur, Vitr 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n47785.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a tension</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contraction of the nerves</hi>, as a disease: <cit><quote lang="la">nervorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 101" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:255" default="NO">255</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecordiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:ib. 260" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 260</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
tensura: <entryFree id="n47786" type="main" key="tensu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tensūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stretching out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a straining</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tension</hi> (post-class.): papilionis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a setting up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pitching</hi>, Hyg. Gromat. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
tensus: <entryFree id="n47787" type="main" key="tensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of tendo.</entryFree>
tentabundus: <entryFree id="n47788" type="hapax" key="tenta_bundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tentābundus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tempt-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tento</etym>, <sense id="n47788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">making attempts</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miles tentabundus,</quote> <trans><tr>trying here and there</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:36:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 36, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tentamen: <entryFree id="n47789" type="main" key="tenta_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tentāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47789.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">essay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attempt</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. only in the two foll. passages): prima vocis tentamina sumpsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 341</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentamina Repellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:734" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 734</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tentamentum: <entryFree id="n47790" type="main" key="tenta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tentāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proof essay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attempt</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; usu. in <number>plur.</number>). </sense><sense id="n47790.1" n="(a)" level="5"> In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortalia Tentamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 629</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fide (i. e. fidei),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:728" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 728</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civilium bellorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47790.2" n="(b)" level="5"> In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentamenti gratiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:15:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentamento frustrati,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 2, 4 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
tentatio: <entryFree id="n47791" type="main" key="tenta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tentātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n47791.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An attack</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudinem tuam jam confirmatam esse et a vetere morbo et a novis tentationibus, gaudeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 17, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47791.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A trial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">proof</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">perseverantiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:42:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 42, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 23, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47791.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Temptation</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 6, 13</bibl> et saep. <cb n="TENT" /></sense></entryFree>
tentator: <entryFree id="n47792" type="main" key="tenta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tentātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tento</etym>. <sense id="n47792.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An assailant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attempter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tempter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">integrae Dianae (Orion),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:4:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 4, 71</bibl></cit>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">the tempter</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the devil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 1, 384</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47792.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">He who attacks</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">autumnus, tentator valetudinum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 48 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
tenthredon: <entryFree id="n47793" type="main" key="Tenthre_don"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tenthrēdon</orth>, <itype>ō^nis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*tenqrhdw/n,</foreign> <sense id="n47793.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of Prothŏus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 98" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tentigo: <entryFree id="n47794" type="main" key="tenti_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tentīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tendo</etym>, <sense id="n47794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tension; lecherousness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lust</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 118</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">34</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:67:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 67, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:129" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 129</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tentipellium: <entryFree id="n47795" type="main" key="tenti^pelli^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tentĭpellĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tendo-pellis</etym>, <sense id="n47795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which stretches out a skin</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hidestretcher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leather-stretcher.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47795.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentipellium Artorius putat esse calceamentum ferratum, quo pelles extenduntur, indeque Afranium dixisse in Promo. pro manibus credo habere ego illos tentipellium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=364" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 364</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:73:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 73, 1</bibl>. — * </sense><sense id="n47795.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: Titinnium ait Verrius existimare id (sc. tentipellium) medicamentum esse, quo rugae extenduntur, cum dicat: tentipellium inducitur, rugae in ore extenduntur, cum ille <foreign lang="greek">tropikw=s</foreign> dixerit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=364" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 364</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
tento: <entryFree id="n47796" type="main" key="tento"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tento</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">tempto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype> (<sense id="n47796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. gen. plur.</hi> tentantum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:247" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 247</bibl>), <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>tendo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to handle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">touch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">feel</hi> a thing (class.; cf.: tango, tracto). </sense><sense id="n47796.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47796.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem manu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 49, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manibus pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 282</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 289</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca feminarum digitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficum rostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:254" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen vix pede (with attingere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quadratum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput in tenebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullos singulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invisos amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:563" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 563</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem pugionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 49</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">acumen stili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rhet. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia emittit temptanti maria similis Sarpedon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 27, § 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pullos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:8" default="NO">8, 11, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47796.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47796.4" n="1" level="3"> In medic. lang.: <cit><quote lang="la">venas,</quote> <trans><tr>to feel the pulse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:88" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 139</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47796.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To try the strength of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make an attempt upon</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to attack</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assail</hi> (cf.: aggredior, adorior). </sense><sense id="n47796.6" n="(a)" level="5"> Of warfare: <cit><quote lang="la">scalis et classe moenia oppidi tentans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 38, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 35, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia Aiexandriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Achaiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 55</bibl></cit> Britanniam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggredi et tentare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:113:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 113, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem auxiliis Thraciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:14:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 14, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47796.7" n="(b)" level="5"> Of disease, poison, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">animi valentes morbo tentari non possunt, corpora possunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:14:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 14, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis auctumnus omnem exercitum valetudine tentaverat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temptari a morbo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 113, § 174</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecordiorum inflatione tentari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:81" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentatus est motiunculis levibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vesp. 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 163</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:441 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 441 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina temptant caput,</quote> <trans><tr>attack</tr>, <tr>affect</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 20, § 35</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">temptantis aquas non nocere,</quote> <trans><tr>unwholesome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 7, 26, § 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 94</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47796.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to try; to prove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put to the test; to attempt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">essay</hi> a course of action, etc. (so most freq.; syn.: experior, periclitor). </sense><sense id="n47796.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen., constr. with <case>acc.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47796.10" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum se ipse perspexerit totumque tentarit, intelleget, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:22:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 22, 59</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">se in arte memoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 34</bibl></cit> (preceded by memoriam suam experiri): <cit><quote lang="la">tentarem te, quo animo accipias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo utamur quasi equis temptatis, sic amicitiā aliquā parte periclitatis moribus amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:17:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 17, 63</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus scientiam auguratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:17:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 17, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentarem summi regis prudentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut satis impulsas tentavit pollice chordas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">culturam agelli, Lucr 5, 1368: iter per provinciam per vim, Caes B. G. 1, 14: negatā iter viā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 2, 22</bibl></cit> Bosporum, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thetim ratibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Istrum, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 135: aditus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temptanda via est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tentandum vadum fluminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9:15" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo modo animus audientis aut incitari aut leniri potest, qui modus a me non tentatus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:38:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 38, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem frustra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli fortunam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 36</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">fortunam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; 7, 64; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 7, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">periculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Cornel. Fragm. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:57:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 57, 157</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patientiam vestram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spem pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spem triumphi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:38:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 38, 4</bibl></cit>: libertatem,<pb n="1856" /> <cb n="TENU" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:18:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 18, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">relationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intercessionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:8:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silentium nequicquam per praeconem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 34</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n47796.11" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentavi, quid in eo genere possem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentabam, spiraret an non,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sit fortuna facillima, temptat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:761" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 761</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tentaret si qua res esset cibi,</quote> <trans><tr>something to eat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenta, Chrysogonus quanti doceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:175" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 175</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47796.12" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquā prohibere hostem tentare coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:40" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentabo etiam de hoc dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:14:1" default="NO">2, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sol) caelum radiis accendere tentans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 659</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentarunt aequore tingi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vestis) frustra tentata revelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:9:168" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus irasci in cornua temptat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo in sese tentat descendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:23" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras deferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:7:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 7, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47796.13" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ille Romuli senatus tentaret post Romuli excessum, ut ipse gereret sine rege rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:12:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 12, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid aliud hoc judicio tentatur, nisi ut id fieri liceat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 11</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentatum a L. Sextio tribuno plebis, ut rogationem ferret, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:49:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 49, 6</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenta quā lubet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne tentando cautiorem faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:23" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47796.14" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to try</hi> any one, in a friendly or hostile manner; <hi rend="ital">to urge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite; to tempt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tamper with;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">to excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">agitate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem ego toties omni ratione tentans ad disputandum elicere non potuissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum per Drusum saepe tentassem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 21, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum admonitus an tentatus an, etc. ... pervenerit ad hanc improbitatem nescio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:41:section=105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 41, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum a proximis impetrare non possent, ulteriores tentant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos servorum spe et metu, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:63:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 63, 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos popularium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 48, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos singulorum ad res novas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum precando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium pecunia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 4, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">30, 80</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem promissis et minis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 75</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tentatā Othonianorum fide per colloquium et promissa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunos de fugae societate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos multā caede bidentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Junonem tentare Ixion ausus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:73" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 73</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 389</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:7" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nationes lacessere bello et tentare,</quote> <trans><tr>to agitate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut exsul potius tentare quam consul vexare rem publicam posses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 10, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in his rebus evertendis unius hominis senectus, infirmitas solitudoque tentata est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militis iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:529" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 529</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 22, 1</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
tentor: <entryFree id="n47797" type="gloss" key="tentor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tentor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a holder</hi>, a sort of servant or attendant employed at chariotraces, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 339, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">340, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tentoriolum: <entryFree id="n47798" type="hapax" key="tento_ri^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tentōrĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>tentorium</etym>, <sense id="n47798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little tent</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 47, 5.</sense></entryFree>
tentorium: <entryFree id="n47799" type="main" key="tento_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tentōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tendo; prop. something stretched out</etym>, <sense id="n47799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tent</hi> (syn. tabernaculum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:5" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:96" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 18 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:469" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 469</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:527" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 527</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 249</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 396</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:270" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 270</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:912" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 912</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tentorius: <entryFree id="n47800" type="hapax" key="tento_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tentōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tentorium</etym>, <sense id="n47800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">for tents</hi>: pelles, <hi rend="ital">tent-skins</hi>, Val. ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tentus: <entryFree id="n47801" type="main" key="tentus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tentus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um. <sense id="n47801.0" n="I" level="1"> <mood>Part.</mood> of tendo.— </sense><sense id="n47801.1" n="II" level="1"> <mood>Part.</mood> of teneo.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47802" type="main" key="tentu^s2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tentŭs</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>teneo</etym>, <sense id="n47802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a checking</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haemorrhoidarum fluoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tentyra: <entryFree id="n47803" type="main" key="Tenty^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tentyra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*te/ntura, ta/,</foreign> <sense id="n47803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city in Upper Egypt</hi>, the modern village of <hi rend="ital">Denderah</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:35" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 35</bibl> and 76.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tentyris</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 11, § 60</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n47803.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tentyrītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Tentyra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tentyrite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 9, § 49</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tentyrītae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Tentyra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tentyrites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 25, 38, § 92</bibl> (better, Tentyri insula); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:2:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 4, 2, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47803.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tentyrītĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Tentyra</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Tentyric</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">linum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tenuabilis: <entryFree id="n47804" type="hapax" key="te^nu^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnŭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tenuo</etym>, <sense id="n47804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">making thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attenuating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unctiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:4:34" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 4, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tenuatim: <entryFree id="n47805" type="hapax" key="te^nu^a_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnŭātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thinly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 2, 4</bibl> <cb n="TENU" /></sense></entryFree>
tenuescens: <entryFree id="n47806" type="main" key="te^nu^escens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnŭescens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [tenuis], <sense id="n47806.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">growing thin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lunā crescente, opp. tenuescente,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> Fragm. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tenuiarius: <entryFree id="n47807" type="gloss" key="te^nu^i^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnŭĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to thin clothing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">VESTIARIVS,</quote> <trans><tr>a maker of light clothing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 650, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1111, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Gud.</author> 200, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 939, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tenuiculus: <entryFree id="n47808" type="hapax" key="te^nu^i^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnŭĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n47808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">slight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trifling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apparatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 19, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tenuis: <entryFree id="n47809" type="main" key="te^nu^is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnŭis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (in the poets also as dissyl. tēnuis, and hence sometimes written <orth extent="full" lang="la">ten-vis</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:875" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 875</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:232" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 232</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:232 al" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 232 al.</bibl>; cf. <sense id="n47809.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">tenuia and tenuius, trisyl.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:808" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 808</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:243" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 243</bibl>, v. Carey, Lat. Prosody, § 47), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>root in Sanscr. tanu; ten., Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tei/nw;</foreign> prop. stretched out, drawn out; v. teneo; hence</etym>, <hi rend="ital">thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">close</hi>, etc. (syn.: gracilis, exilis). </sense><sense id="n47809.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47809.2" n="1" level="3"> Of texture, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subtemen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:53" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:707" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 707</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 4, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">togae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toga filo tenuissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:445" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 445</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:319" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 319</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura oculos membranis tenuissimis vestivit et saepsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arietes tenuioris velleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:2:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47809.3" n="2" level="3"> Of substance, <hi rend="ital">thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenue caelum (opp. crassum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 4, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">tenue purumque caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:130" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 57, 130</bibl></cit>: aër, <hi rend="ital">rare</hi> (with purus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:16:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 16, 42</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aethereus locus tenuissimus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:68" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <trans><tr>thin</tr>, <tr>watery</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:110" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 28, 33, § 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:39" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 22, § 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <trans><tr>clear</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:250" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 250</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis (opp. crassus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:221" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 38, 90, § 221</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmen (militum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:23:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 23, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 64</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pluviae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47809.4" n="3" level="3"> Of form, <hi rend="ital">slim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lank</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">penna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cauda (piscis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 726</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 7, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:3:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitedula,</quote> <trans><tr>thin</tr>, <tr>lank</tr>, <tr>meagre</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">canes macie tenues,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyn. 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gellius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:89:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 89, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thais,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:101:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 101, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbra (defuncti),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animae (defunctorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 411</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:565" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 565</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n47809.5" n="4" level="3"> Of sounds, <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thin</hi>: vox, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 6, 4, 12</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 59 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:32" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 32</bibl>. — </sense><sense id="n47809.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slight</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trifling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum tenue sane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:22:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 22, § 53</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">magnae quondam urbis tenue vestigium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 4, 5, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:4:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <trans><tr>shallow</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:250" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 250</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rivulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:19:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 19, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sulcus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foramen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 2, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insignis tenui fronte Lycoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:33:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 33, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuem victum antefert copioso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:20:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 20, 49</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">victus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:28:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 28, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:23:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 23, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 16, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuissimum patrimonium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 38, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res (familiaris),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 20, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">census,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 7, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">honores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuissimum lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pumex,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>light</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 1, 8. — <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">poor</hi> persons: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis (opp. locuples),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:20:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 20, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus sit an liber, pecuniosus an tenuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:25:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 25, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae constitui tenuiorum videbantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:48:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 48, 103</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">locupletissimi cujusque census extenuarant, tenuissimi auxerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:55:section=138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 55, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis et obaeratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Regulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:20:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 20, 13</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis opum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:19" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47809.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47809.8" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nice</hi>, <hi rend="ital">delicate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subtle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exact</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">elegans, subtilis): tenuis et acuta distinctio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 14, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tenues autem differentias (praecepta) habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:35" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(oratores) tenues, acuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:5:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 5, 20</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">orator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:913" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 913</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:6:37" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenae,</quote> <trans><tr>elegant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:64:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 64, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes latiore specie, non ad tenue limatae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">textum dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 64</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnŭe</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">that which is subtle</hi> (opp. comprehensibile), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 4, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47809.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (acc. to I. B.), <hi rend="ital">weak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trifling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insignificant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">low</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tenuissimā valetudine esset,</quote> <trans><tr>weak</tr>, <tr>feeble</tr>, <tr>delicate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis atque infirmus animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium (opp. forte),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis et angusta ingeni vena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: tenuis<cb n="TENU" />  exsanguisque sermo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:13:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 13, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ininimis tenuissimisque rebus labi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuissimarum rerum jura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artificium perquam tenue et leve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grammatica, ars tenuis ac jejuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inanis et tenuis spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:14:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 14, 43</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">spes tenuior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 19, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspitio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:15:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 15, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa tenuis et inops,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 9, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotia paulo ad dicendum tenuiora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec sua plus debet tenui Verona Catullo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to the author of trifling</tr>, <tr>amorous lays</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:103:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 103, 5</bibl></cit>; v. tenuo, II. — </sense><sense id="n47809.10" n="2" level="3"> Esp., of rank, standing, etc., <hi rend="ital">low</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inferior</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuiores,</quote> <trans><tr>men of lower rank</tr>, <tr>the lower orders</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 10, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis L. Virginius unusque de multis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuissimus quisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:47:section=123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 47, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:34:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 34, 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">commoti animi tenuiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 23, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si obscuri erunt aut tenues,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:34:117" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Part. Or. 34, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tenuioris ordinis essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:13:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentes tenui loco orti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>. — <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnŭĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n47809.11" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47809.12" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Thinly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alutae tenuiter confectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47809.13" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Indifferently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poorly: Da.</hi> Quid rei gerit? <hi rend="ital">Ge.</hi> Sic, tenuiter. <hi rend="ital">Da.</hi> Non multum habet, Quod det, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47809.14" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47809.15" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Finely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acutely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exactly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subtilely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuiter disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:14:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 14, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuiter multa, multa sublimiter tenere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere (with argute),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 6:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuiter et argute multa disserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">illae (argumentationes) tenuius et acutius et subtilius tractantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:16:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 16, 51</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47809.16" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Lightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slightly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">superficially</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi nimium tenuiter Siculorum erga te voluntatis argumenta colligere videor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:65:section=157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 65, § 157</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 8, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 36, 48</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuissime aestimare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:16:section=35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 16, § 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tenuitas: <entryFree id="n47810" type="main" key="te^nu^i^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnŭĭtas</orth>, ātis. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tenuis</etym>, <sense id="n47810.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thinness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slenderness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fineness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smallness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tenuity</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n47810.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">casurusne in conspectum videatur animus, an tanta sit ejus tenuitas, ut fugiat aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:22:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 22, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudo modo bona sit, tenuitas ipsa delectat,</quote> <trans><tr>slimness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 16, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 12, 6</bibl></cit>: aëris, <hi rend="ital">rarity</hi> (with siccitas), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:10:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 10, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 2, § 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 12, 24, § 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillamenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 65, § 171</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">liniam duxit summae tenuitatis per tabulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caudae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 33, 51, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cribri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 11, 27, § 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>thinness</tr>, <tr>clearness</tr>, <tr>purity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 3, 23, § 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 39, 92, § 226</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n47810.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (acc. to tenuis, I. B.), <hi rend="ital">smallness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insignificance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poverty</hi>, <hi rend="ital">indigence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scarcity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Magii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicujus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fil. Fam. 16, 21, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aerarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:21:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 21, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">earum rerum, quas terra procreet, vel ubertatem vel tenuitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:13:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 13, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47810.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fineness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acuteness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">minuteness</hi> in language: <cit><quote lang="la">limata tenuitas et rerum et verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:12:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 12, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 3, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(dialectica) sectas ad tenuitatem suam vires ipsā subtilitate consumet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:35" default="NO">12, 10, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:2:23" default="NO">10, 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discriminum ac differentiarum tenuitates,</quote> <trans><tr>fine shades</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3:29" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tenuiter: <entryFree id="n47811" type="main" key="te^nu^i^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnŭĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tenuis <sense id="n47811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tenuo: <entryFree id="n47812" type="main" key="te^nu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnŭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tenuis</etym>, <sense id="n47812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meagre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rare; to dilute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rarefy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attenuate</hi>, etc. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; syn.: rarefacio, minuo). </sense><sense id="n47812.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">assiduo vomer tenuatur ab usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:43" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc (tempus) tenuat dentem aratri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol matutinum aëra spissum et umidum ortu suo tenuat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:3:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 3, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">aëra,</quote> <trans><tr>to rarefy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:338" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 338</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsā autem macie tenuant armenta volentes,</quote> <trans><tr>make lean</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuatum corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus parvo victu tenuatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exiles videor tenuatus in artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:22" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 22</bibl></cit> (3, 15), 21: <cit><quote lang="la">se in undas,</quote> <trans><tr>to dissolve into water</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:761" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 761</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">artus in undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 551</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuatus in auras, Aëraque umor abit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:246" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 246</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis via est tenuata,</quote> <trans><tr>narrowed</tr>, <tr>contracted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:498" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina per multos rivos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 445</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">chartam interpolatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 23, § 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adipes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna quater plenum tenuata retexuit orbem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>waning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:531" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 531</bibl></cit>: ne ad <pb n="1857" /> <cb n="TEPE" /> spadonum exilitatem vox nostra tenuetur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 19</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 32</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n47812.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make small</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trifling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to lessen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diminish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reduce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">weaken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enfeeble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utque meae famam tenuent oblivia culpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:65" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 20, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires amoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:374" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 374</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magna modis tenuare parvis,</quote> <trans><tr>to lessen</tr>, <tr>degrade</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gesta tanti viri enumerando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0116,001:Pan. ad Theod. 5" default="NO"><author>Pac.</author> Pan. ad Theod. 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 127</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicite, quo pariter carmen tenuastis in antro,</quote> <trans><tr>have spun out a slight elegiac poem</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 1, 5; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Maximo carmen tenuare tanto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:7:2" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; v. tenuis, II. B.</sense></entryFree>
tenus: <entryFree id="n47813" type="greek" key="te^nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnus</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>root ten-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tei/nw;</foreign> v. teneo</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">te/nos,</foreign> <sense id="n47813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">snare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">springe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intendere tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tenus est laqueus, dictus a tendiculā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenus est proprie extrema pars arcūs,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 62</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47814" type="main" key="te^nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tĕnus</orth> <etym>root ten; v. teneo</etym>, perh. orig., an <case>acc.</case> of direction, and hence joined with <sense id="n47814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.;</hi> afterwards a <pos>prep.</pos> with <case>abl.</case> (its supposed construction with the <case>acc.</case> rests upon a false reading in the passages, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 12, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:537" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 537</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 52</bibl>, where the <case>abl.</case> is the true reading), prop. <hi rend="ital">lengthwise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to the end;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">as far as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">up</hi> or <hi rend="ital">down to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unto</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to</hi> (placed after its case; mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n47814.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. ( <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> ) With <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> (so not in the prose of Cicero): <cit><quote lang="la">labrorum tenus,</quote> <trans><tr>along the lips</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:940" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 940</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumborum tenus,</quote> <trans><tr>as far as the loins</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=83" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 83</bibl></cit> (324): <cit><quote lang="la">crurum tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laterum tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per aquam ferme genūs tenus altam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 40, 8</bibl></cit>: aurium tenus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 17</bibl>: illi rumores Cumarum tenus caluerunt, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbium Corcyrae tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 24, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47814.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> (so most freq. in prose and poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">Tauro tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:13:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 13, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arimino tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antio tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ostiā tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aethiopiā tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erat pectoribus tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:54:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 54, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inguinibus tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pube tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:427" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 427</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summo tenus ore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 737</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collo tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectoribus tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:512" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 512</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">15, 673: poplite deinde tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:593" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 593</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pennis tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:258" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 258</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediā tenus alvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:145" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lateri capulo tenus abdidit ensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:553" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 553</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poti faece tenus cadi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:15:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 15, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres regiones solo tenus dejectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectis tenus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extollere caelo tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:6:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 6, 2</bibl></cit>.—Of time: <cit><quote lang="la">Cantabrico tenus bello nec ultra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:85" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 85</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">volneribus tenus, of the fighting of gladiators,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 20, 12</bibl></cit> et saep.—So the compounds, eātenus, hactenus, quātenus, quādantenus, v. h. vv.—</sense><sense id="n47814.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n47814.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">After</hi>, <hi rend="ital">according to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertium et quartum consulatum titulo tenus gessit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">titulo tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:1:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 1, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">facie tenus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>for the sake of appearances</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 250, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">specie tenus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrore tenus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 16, 8, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47814.5" n="B" level="2"> Verbo tenus, less freq. nomine tenus, <hi rend="ital">as far as the meaning of the word extends</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nominally</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">veteres verbo tenus ... de re publicā disserebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:6:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec verba cum affectu accipimus, non verbo tenus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usurpatas nomine tenus urbium expugnationes dictitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
