D. 2, 16, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiarum terrenae sunt aliae, partim aquatiles,</quote> <trans><tr>that live on land</tr>, <tr>land-animals</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 37, 103</bibl></cit>: de perturbationibus caelestibus et maritimis et terrenis non possumus dicere, id <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3, 7, 16</bibl>. — <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aqua piscibus, ut sicca terrenis convenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <trans><tr>a land-journey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 87</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:52" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 17, 19, § 52</bibl>. — <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">eques Bellerophon,</quote> <trans><tr>earthly</tr>, <tr>mortal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numina,</quote> <trans><tr>that dwell in the earth</tr>, <tr>earthly</tr>, <tr>terrene</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 248</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">earthly</hi> (eccl. Lat.; opp. caelestis): honores terrenos promittit, ut caelestes adimat, Cypr. de Zelo et <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrena ac fragilia haec bona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 22, 14</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47900.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">terrēna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n47900.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Earthly things</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perishable things</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 17</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47900.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Land-animals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:11:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 11, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
terreo: <entryFree id="n47901" type="main" key="terre^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. root tras-, trasāmi, tremble; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">tre/w</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n47901.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to frighten</hi>,<pb n="1861" /> <cb n="TERR" />  <hi rend="ital">affright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put in fear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to alarm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrify.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47901.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class. and very freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">nec me ista terrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversarios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:20:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 20, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui urbem totam . . . caede incendiisque terreret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eum hominem istis mortis aut exsilii minis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suae malae cogitationes terrent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:24:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 24, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maris subita tempestas terret navigantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:22:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites . . . alii se abdere, pars territos confirmare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum ad terrendos nostros valuit clamor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis metu territi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:7:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 7, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:4:16" default="NO">9, 4, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem proscriptionis denuntiatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:35:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 35, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metu poenāque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:4:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 5, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in scenā videtis homines consceleratos impulsu deorum terreri Furiarum taedis ardentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 20, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrere metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 6, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">territus hoste novo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 115</bibl></cit>. — With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi> and <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Samnites maxime territi, ne ab altero exercitu integro intactoque fessi opprimerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:14:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 14, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terruit urbem, Terruit gentes, grave ne rediret Saeculum Pyrrhae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:2:4 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 2, 4 sq.</bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">territus animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 4, 50</bibl></cit> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 34, 4</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ultro territuri succlamationibus, concurrunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:26:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 26, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47901.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47901.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To drive away by terror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to frighten</hi> or <hi rend="ital">scare away</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">profugam per totum terruit orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 727</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fures vel falce vel inguine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:640" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 640</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">has (Nymphas) pastor fugatas terruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:14:518" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 518</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres (harundo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe etiam audacem fugat hoc terretque poëtam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terret ambustus Phaethon avaras Spes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 11, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47901.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To deter by terror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to scare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frighten</hi> from any action: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem metu gravioris servitii a repetendā libertate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:41:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 41, 6</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">ut, si nostros loco depulsos vidisset, quo minus libere hostes insequerentur, terreret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 49</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 63</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria pessimi proximo bello exempli terrebat, ne rem committerent eo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 45, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesentiā tuā, ne auderent transitum, terruisti, Auct. Pan. ap. Constant. 22: non territus ire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicos loqui terrent amplitudine potestatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 7, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
terrestris: <entryFree id="n47902" type="main" key="terrestris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrestris</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (<sense id="n47902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nom. masc.</hi> terrester, Flor 2, 2, 4; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>terra</etym>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the earth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to the land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earth-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">land-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrestrial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant animantium genera quattuor, quorum unum divinum atque caeleste, alterum pennigerum et aërium, tertium aquatile, terrestre quartum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admiratio rerum caelestium atque terrestrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:30:75" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 30, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Capitolio, hoc est in terrestri domicilio Jovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:58:section=129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 58, § 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrestris coepulonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">archipirata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:27:section=70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 27, § 70</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">populus vere terrester,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit> Duk.: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <trans><tr>land - forces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelia,</quote> <trans><tr>battles by land</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Alcib. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <trans><tr>land-journey</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 6, 6, § 39</bibl></cit>; Auct. B. Alex. 25, 1; <cit><quote lang="la">32, 1: coturnices, parva avis et terrestris potius quam sublimis,</quote> <trans><tr>remaining on the ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 33, § 64</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">He.</hi> Terrestris cena est. <hi rend="ital">Er.</hi> Sus terrestris bestia'st, <hi rend="ital">a supper from the ground</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">consisting of vegetables</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 86</bibl>. — Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">terrestrĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. animalia), <hi rend="ital">land-animals</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in terrestribus serpentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:169 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 62, 82, § 169 sq.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
terreus: <entryFree id="n47903" type="main" key="terre^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earthen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrea progenies duris caput extulit arvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 341</bibl></cit> (al. ferrea, Rib.): fossa et terreus agger, <hi rend="ital">a dam</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dike of earth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">murus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> L. L. 5, § 48</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
terribilis: <entryFree id="n47904" type="main" key="terri^bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>terreo</etym>, <sense id="n47904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">frightful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dreadful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrible</hi> (class.; syn.: dirus, horribilis, torvus). </sense><sense id="n47904.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam terribilis aspectu!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 8, 19</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jam ipsi urbi terribilis erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">furiis accensus et irā terribilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:947" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 947</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terribilis cunctis et invisus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noverca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannus affatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:3:73" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 3, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visu formae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:277" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 277</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">squalor Charontis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 299</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">incultu, tenebris, odore foeda atque terribilis ejus (carceris) facies est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 55:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 55, 4</bibl></cit>: at tuba terribili sonitu taratantara dixit, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 842</bibl> P. (Ann. v. 452 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">sonitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 155</bibl></cit>: tumultus, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=153" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 153</bibl> Müll. (Ann. <cb n="TERR" /> v. 311 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">caligo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:852" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 852</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:160" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exspectatio adventūs Jubae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 66</bibl></cit>. — <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus (viri) virtute terribilior erat populus Romanus exteris gentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:26:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 26, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alia aliis terribiliora afferentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 26, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">majora ac terribiliora afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 29, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47904.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">demanding reverence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">venerable</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">scripturae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 1, 13</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> seems not to occur.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">fearfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dreadfully</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terribly</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sonus caeli terribiliter concrepantis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">admonere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 12:25" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 12, 25</bibl></cit>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:138:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 138, 14</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> seem not to occur.</sense></entryFree>
terribilitas: <entryFree id="n47905" type="main" key="terri^bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>terribilis</etym>, <sense id="n47905.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the quality of inspiring terror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">horrible aspect</hi>, Jornand, Get. 24.</sense></entryFree>
terribiliter: <entryFree id="n47906" type="main" key="terri^bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭbĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. terribilis <sense id="n47906.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
terricola: <entryFree id="n47907" type="main" key="terri^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>terra-colo</etym>, <sense id="n47907.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dweller upon earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a terrestrial</hi> (ante- and post-class.): terricolae Lamiae, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter terricolas caelicolasque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. 45, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
terricrepus: <entryFree id="n47908" type="main" key="terri^cre^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭcrĕpus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>terror-crepo</etym>, <sense id="n47908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">frightfully thundering</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 8:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 8, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
terricula: <entryFree id="n47909" type="main" key="terri^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">ter-rĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>) [terreo], <sense id="n47909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">means of exciting terror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a fright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scarecrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bugbear</hi> (very rare; not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n47909.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>: proinde ista haec tua aufer terricula, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 227, 31</bibl> (Trag. Fragm. v. 324, 623): <cit><quote lang="la">nullis minis, nullis terriculis se motos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine tribuniciae potestatis terriculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47909.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi> (ante- and post-class.): pertimuistis cassam terriculam adversari, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 352, 26</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 270 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">terriculas tyrannicae potestatis profligare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Mort. Persec. 16 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes terriculae suppliciorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
terriculamenta: <entryFree id="n47910" type="main" key="terri^cu^la_menta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭcŭlāmenta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>terricula</etym>, <sense id="n47910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">things that excite terror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frights</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrors</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sepulchrorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 315, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodigiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inane terriculamentum bonis hominibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 50, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
terrifagus: <entryFree id="n47911" type="main" key="terri^fa^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭfăgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>terra, <foreign lang="greek">fa/gw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n47911.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">eating dust</hi> (eccl. Lat.): serpens, Jul. ap. Aug. c. Sec. Resp. Jul. 6, 28.</sense></entryFree>
terrificatio: <entryFree id="n47912" type="hapax" key="terri^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>terrifico</etym>, <sense id="n47912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a frightening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrifying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terror</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">imaginum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 135, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
terrifico: <entryFree id="n47913" type="main" key="terri^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>terrificus</etym>, <sense id="n47913.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make afraid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to frighten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alarm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrify</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecique in nubibus ignes Terrificant animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 210</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:7:678" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 7, 678</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
terrificus: <entryFree id="n47914" type="main" key="terri^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>terreo-facio</etym>, <sense id="n47914.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that causes terror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frightful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrific</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">(Curetes) cristae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 632</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1314" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1314</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caesaries capitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 179</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:785" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 785</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vaticinationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
terrigena: <entryFree id="n47915" type="main" key="terri^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> (<sense id="n47915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr. plur. adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrigena animalia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 2, 12</bibl></cit>) [terra-gigno], <hi rend="ital">born of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from the earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earth-born;</hi> a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> epithet of the first men, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1411</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1427" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 1427</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 8, 11</bibl>.—Of the men who sprang up from the dragon's teeth which had been sown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 118</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 141</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 6, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 99</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:505" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 505</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of Typhoeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:325" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 325</bibl></cit>.—Of the giants, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:18" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:306" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 306</bibl>.—Of the serpent, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:254" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 254</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:506" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 506</bibl>.—Of the snail, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:64:133" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 64, 133</bibl>.—Of men in general, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:48:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 48, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
terrigenus: <entryFree id="n47916" type="main" key="terri^ge^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭgĕnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. terrigena <sense id="n47916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
terriloquus: <entryFree id="n47917" type="hapax" key="terri^lo^quus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭlŏquus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>terreo-loquor</etym>, <sense id="n47917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fear-speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fear-inspiring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicta vatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 103</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
terripavium: <entryFree id="n47918" type="main" key="terri^pa^vi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭpăvĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. tripudium.</entryFree>
terripudium: <entryFree id="n47919" type="main" key="terri^pu^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭpŭdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. tripudium.</entryFree>
terrisonus: <entryFree id="n47920" type="hapax" key="terri^so^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭsŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>terreo-sono</etym>, <sense id="n47920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sounding terribly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stridor venientis Alani,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 109</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
territio: <entryFree id="n47921" type="hapax" key="terri^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>terreo</etym>, <sense id="n47921.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a frightening</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alarming</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrifying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">levis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:15:section=41" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 15, § 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
territo: <entryFree id="n47922" type="main" key="terri^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47922.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to put in terror</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to frighten</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alarm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terrify</hi> (class., but perh. not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavor territat mentem animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem territare metu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem supplicio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 63</bibl></cit>: audacter territas, humiliter placas, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 20, 28</bibl>: alias (civitates)<cb n="TERR" />  territando ... alias cohortando, Caes B. G. 5, 54: <cit><quote lang="la">magnas territat urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 187</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 5, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 3, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:4:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 4, 4, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 28, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:322" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 322</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
territorialis: <entryFree id="n47923" type="hapax" key="terri^to_ri^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭtōrĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>territorium</etym>, <sense id="n47923.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to territory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">territorial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">termini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Limit. p. 47" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Limit. p. 47</bibl></cit> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
territorium: <entryFree id="n47924" type="main" key="terri^to_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭtōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>terra</etym>, <sense id="n47924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the land round a town</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a domain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">district</hi>, <hi rend="ital">territory</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">colonis locus communis, qui prope oppidum relinquitur, territorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=21" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 21</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">territorium est universitas agrorum intra fines cujusque civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:239" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 239 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florentis coloniae territorium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:40:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 40, 102</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Neapolitanum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra territorium abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 6, 34, § 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">territoria earum (civitatum) habitare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 2, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
territus: <entryFree id="n47925" type="main" key="terri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of terreo.</entryFree>
terror: <entryFree id="n47926" type="main" key="terror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terror</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>terreo</etym>, <sense id="n47926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">great fear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affright</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alarm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terror</hi> (syn.: pavor, trepidatio, metus). </sense><sense id="n47926.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">definiunt terrorem metum concutientem: ex quo fit, ut pudorem rubor, terrorem pallor et tremor et dentium crepitus consequatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem nos formido timidas terrore impulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terrorem alicui inicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:18:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 18, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferae, injecto terrore mortis horrescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem terrore periculoque mortis repellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Antonio patuisset Gallia ... quantus rei publicae terror impenderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 13, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui terrorem inferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 15, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:26:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 26, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddit inlatum antea terrorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:60:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 60, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneri terrore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:29:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 29, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">esse terrori alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui modo terrori fuerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 28, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantus terror incidit exercitui, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantus repente terror invasit, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanos auxiliares tyranni in terrorem ac tumultum conjecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 28, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic terrore oblato a ducibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum Romae terrorem fecere, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantumque terrorem incussere patribus, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si tantus habet mentes et pectora terror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volgi pectora terror habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:288" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrore pavens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:271" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 271</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in oppido festinatio et ingens terror erat, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 27</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">ingentem Galli terrorem memoriā pristinae cladis attulerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:42:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 42, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terror nominis Alexandri invaserat orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:13:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcanus terror,</quote> <trans><tr>secret dread</tr>, <tr>secret awe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exsurgite, inquit, qui terrore meo occidistis prae metu,</quote> <trans><tr>from dread of me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 5, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: de terrore suo, Auct. B. Afr. 32, 1: saepe totius anni fructus uno rumore periculi atque uno belli terrore amittitur, <hi rend="ital">dread</hi> or <hi rend="ital">apprehension of war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 6, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum terrorem externum esse,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dread of foreign enemies</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:10:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 10, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">peregrinus terror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 16, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terror servilis, ne suus cuique domi hostis esset,</quote> <trans><tr>dread of the slaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnem terrorem vultum componens,</quote> <trans><tr>into frightful expressions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 50</bibl></cit>: (Periclis) vis dicendi terrorque, <hi rend="ital">terrible power</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">deino(ths</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:11:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 11, 44</bibl>. — <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">feri lugubresque terrores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 12, 61</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47926.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">an object of fear</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a terror</hi> (usu. in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">duobus hujus urbis terroribus depulsis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:47:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 47, 71</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">terrores reipublicae (sc. Carthago ac Numantia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:4:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: terrores Romani nominis, Treb. Poll. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:20:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 20, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mediocres terrores jacit atque denuntiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 23, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Battonius miros terrores ad me attulit Caesarianos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Xerxes, terror ante gentium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:1:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dionysius gentium quondam terror,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 11, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
terrosus: <entryFree id="n47927" type="main" key="terro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>terra</etym>, <sense id="n47927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earthy</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
terrula: <entryFree id="n47928" type="main" key="terru^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small piece of land</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a field</hi> (late Lat.): alienae, <hi rend="ital">other men</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s fields</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 10, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 24, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 615</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
terrulente: <entryFree id="n47929" type="main" key="terru^lente_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrŭlentē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. terrulentus.</entryFree>
terrulentus: <entryFree id="n47930" type="main" key="terru^lentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">terrŭlentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>terra</etym>, <sense id="n47930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">earthly</hi> (late Lat.): quod terrulentum ac sordidum, etc., Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 2, 196: <cit><quote lang="la">hic (Cain) terrulentis, ille (Abel) vivis fungitur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>fruits of the earth</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Hamart. 5 praef.</bibl></cit>—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">terrŭlentē</orth> <pb n="1862" /> <cb n="TERT" /> <hi rend="ital">in an earthly manner</hi>: quaerere rem spiritalem, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef.</foreign> 10, 378.</sense></entryFree>
tersus: <entryFree id="n47931" type="main" key="tersus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tersus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of tergeo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47932" type="main" key="tersus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tersus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tergeo</etym>, <sense id="n47932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wiping off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleansing</hi> (Appuleian): <cit><quote lang="la">lintea tersui profer,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tersui dentium petere aliquid,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>for tooth-powder</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 277, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tertia: <entryFree id="n47933" type="main" key="Tertia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tertia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. tertius, a, um, II. B.</entryFree>
tertiadecimani: <entryFree id="n47934" type="hapax" key="terti^ade^ci^ma_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tertĭa-dĕcĭmāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. milites) [tertius], <sense id="n47934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soldiers of the thirteenth legion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tertianus: <entryFree id="n47935" type="main" key="terti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tertĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the third</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tertian.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47935.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertianae febres,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>the tertian fever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 10, 24</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47935.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47935.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tertĭāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. febris), <hi rend="ital">the tertian fever</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:170" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 19, 107, § 170</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertianis et quartanis remedium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 23, 94, § 166</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:150" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25, 72, § 150</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47935.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tertĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. milites), <hi rend="ital">soldiers of the third legion</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tertiarius: <entryFree id="n47936" type="main" key="terti^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tertĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing a third part.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47936.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stannum,</quote> <trans><tr>that contains one part of white and two of black lead</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 17, 48, § 160</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47936.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tertĭārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a third part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a third</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 95, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tertiatio: <entryFree id="n47937" type="hapax" key="terti^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tertĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>tertiatus</etym>, <sense id="n47937.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a doing a thing the third time;</hi> concr., <hi rend="ital">that which is produced by a third operation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miscere tertiationem cum primā pressurā,</quote> <trans><tr>the oil produced by the third pressure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 52, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tertiato: <entryFree id="n47938" type="main" key="terti^a_to_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tertĭātō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. 2. tertio.</entryFree>
terticeps: <entryFree id="n47939" type="gloss" key="terti^ceps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tertĭceps</orth>, <itype>ĭpis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tertius</etym>, <sense id="n47939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the third</hi>: mons, <hi rend="ital">the third hill</hi> (of Rome), an old formula in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=50" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 50</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
tertio: <entryFree id="n47940" type="main" key="terti^o_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tertĭō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tertius <sense id="n47940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> A.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n47941" type="main" key="terti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tertĭo</orth>, no <sense id="n47941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>tertius</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to do for the third time</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">jugerum,</quote> <trans><tr>to plough for the third time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles iterandi tertiandique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Sept. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: tertiata verba, <hi rend="ital">thrice repeated</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">stammered out</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 166 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>— Hence, <hi rend="ital">for the third time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thrice</hi>: verba tertiato et quartato dicere, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 314</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n47941.1" n="II" level="1"> <mood>Part.</mood>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tertĭātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">greater by a third</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <trans><tr>whose length is one third greater than its breadth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Grom. p. 8:1" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Grom. p. 8, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tertiocerius: <entryFree id="n47942" type="main" key="terti^o_ce_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tertĭōcērĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tertius-cera</etym>, <sense id="n47942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a functionary of the third rank</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 12, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 24, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tertium: <entryFree id="n47943" type="main" key="terti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tertĭum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. tertius, B. <sense id="n47943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
tertius: <entryFree id="n47944" type="main" key="terti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tertĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n47944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. ord. adj.</hi> [ter], <hi rend="ital">the third.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47944.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos duo eritis, atque amica tua erit tecum tertia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres video sententias ferri: unam, etc. ... alteram, etc. ... tertiam ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 16, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:26" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic disserunt: si quod sit in obscenitate flagitium, id aut in re esse aut in verbo: nihil esse tertium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 22, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 13, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 37, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertio illo anno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 32, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mancipia venibant Saturnalibus tertiis,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>on the third day of the Saturnalia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab Jove tertius Ajax,</quote> <trans><tr>the third in descent</tr>, <tr>greatgrandson of Jupiter</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per tertia numina juro,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>by the infernal gods</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regna,</quote> <trans><tr>the infernal regions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:584" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 584</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertius e nobis,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>one of us three</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertios creari (censores),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:27:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 27, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertius dies est,</quote> <trans><tr>it is two days since</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllaba ab eā tertia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diebus tertiis,</quote> <trans><tr>every three days</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 7</bibl></cit>. — </sense><sense id="n47944.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47944.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tertĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. partes). </sense><sense id="n47944.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A third part</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">miscentur argento tertiae aeris Cyprii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 9, 46, § 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:20" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 5, 11, § 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad tertias subsederit coctura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:20:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 20, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:35" default="NO">12, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 18, 71, § 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duae tertiae partes,</quote> <trans><tr>two thirds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n47944.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The third part</hi> in a play: <cit><quote lang="la">Spinther secundarum, tertiarumque Pamphilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 12, 10, § 54</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n47944.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tertĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Tertĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">proper names.</hi> The latter in a sarcastic pun: Tertiā deductā (<hi rend="ital">after a third was deducted</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">after Tertia was seduced</hi>), Cic. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:50" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 50</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n47944.7" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tertĭō</orth>. </sense><sense id="n47944.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">For the third time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non hercle veniam tertio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille iterum, ille tertio pecuniam dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Deiot. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguis mittendus est iterum tertioque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>, <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cui ter proditae patriae: semel cum, etc. ... iterum cum, etc. ... tertio hodie, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 9, 11</bibl></cit>; tertio <cb n="TESS" /> consules esse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:60:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 60, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 1</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n47944.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">In the third place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thirdly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec spectans, etc. ... simul, ut, etc. ... tertio, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47944.10" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Three times</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">parietes tertio obducere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; Treb. Gall. 17. — </sense><sense id="n47944.11" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">tertĭum</orth>, <hi rend="ital">for the third time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo est quin saepe jactans Venerium jaciat aliquando, non numquam etiam iterum ac tertium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:59:121" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 59, 121</bibl></cit>: veniunt iterum atque tertium, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 196</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">idque iterum tertiumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 28, § 139</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules creati Q. Fabius Vibulanus tertium et L. Cornelius Maluginensis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 22, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:27:2" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 27, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mori consulem tertium oportuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:67:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 67, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 10" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tertiusdecimus: <entryFree id="n47945" type="main" key="terti^usde^ci^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tertĭus-dĕcĭmus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-dĕcŭmus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n47945.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. ord. adj.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the thirteenth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 4 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mense,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:36:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 36, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 44, 69, § 171</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertiadecuma legio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 37</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tertullianus: <entryFree id="n47946" type="main" key="Tertulli^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Tertullĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n47946.0" n="A" level="2"> Q. Septimius Florens, <hi rend="ital">Tertullian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a learned father of the Church</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a native of Carthage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the first half of the third century of the Christian era</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 4, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 8, 5, 60</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47946.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A celebrated jurist under Septimius Severus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:29:2:30:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 29, 2, 30, § 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:28:5:3:section=2" default="NO">28, 5, 3, § 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tertus: <entryFree id="n47947" type="main" key="tertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> of tergeo.</entryFree>
teruncius: <entryFree id="n47948" type="main" key="terunci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ter-uncĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. nummus) [uncia]. <sense id="n47948.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">three twelfths of an</hi> as, <hi rend="ital">a quarter</hi> - as, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=174" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 174</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47948.1" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a trifle</hi>: sic in provinciā nos gerimus, ut nullus teruncius insumatur in quemquam, i. q. <hi rend="ital">not a farthing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not a cent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 17, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:14:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 14, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non jam teruncii faciunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 323, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47948.2" n="II" level="1"> Of inheritances, <hi rend="ital">the fourth part</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Curius fecit palam te (heredem) ex libellā, me ex teruncio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
terveneficus: <entryFree id="n47949" type="hapax" key="terve^ne_fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ter-vĕnēfĭcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n47949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">thrice poisoner</hi>, i. q. <hi rend="ital">triple-dyed scoundrel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thorough knave</hi>, as a term of abuse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 7, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tesca: <entryFree id="n47950" type="main" key="tesca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tesca</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">tesqua</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype> (the <number>sing.</number> v. in foll.), <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n47950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rough</hi> or <hi rend="ital">wild regions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wastes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deserts</hi>: tesqua sive tescua <foreign lang="greek">kata/krhmnoi kai\ r(a/xeis kai\ e)/rhmoi to/poi,</foreign> Gloss. Philox.: deserta et tesca loca, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 11</bibl> Müll.; v. Varr. in loc.: loca aspera, saxea tesca tuor, Cic. poët. ap. Fest. pp. 356 and 357 Müll.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">deserta et inhospita tesca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemorosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remota,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 358, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> p. 348, 22. Such places were sacred to the gods: loca quaedam agrestia, quae alicujus dei sunt, dicuntur tesca, Varr. l. l.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: templum tescumque finito in sinistrum, an old religious formula, Varr. l. l.; cf. Fest. l. l.</sense></entryFree>
tessaracoste: <entryFree id="n47951" type="main" key="tessa^ra^coste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tessărăcostē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">tessarakosth/,</foreign> <sense id="n47951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fortieth day</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 3, § 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tessella: <entryFree id="n47952" type="main" key="tessella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tessella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>tessera</etym>, <sense id="n47952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small square piece of stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a little cube</hi>, for pavements, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:31:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 31, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:132" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:120" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 16, 26, § 120</bibl>; Inscr. Oreil. 4316.</sense></entryFree>
tessellarius: <entryFree id="n47953" type="main" key="tessella_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tessellārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>tessella</etym>, <sense id="n47953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who makes</hi> tessellae, for pavements or for playing, Cod. Th. 13, 4, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4289</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tessellatim: <entryFree id="n47954" type="main" key="tessella_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tessellātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a checkered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tesselated form</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">concidere spathulam porcinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incidere pernam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tessellatus: <entryFree id="n47955" type="main" key="tessella_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tessellātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of small square stones</hi>, <hi rend="ital">checkered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tesselated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavimenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tessera: <entryFree id="n47956" type="greek" key="tesse^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tessĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">te/sseres, a</foreign> (lon. for <foreign lang="greek">te=ssares, a,</foreign> four), <sense id="n47956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a square</hi>, <hi rend="ital">square piece</hi> of stone, wood, etc., for various purposes. </sense><sense id="n47956.1" n="I" level="1"> Most freq., <hi rend="ital">a die</hi> for playing, numbered on all the six sides (while the tali, prop. pastern-bones, were marked only on four sides; v. talus; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. alea): ludere tesseris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut homines ad pilam se aut ad talos aut ad tesseras conferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:15:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 15, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tesseras jacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:85" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 41, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 16, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in tesserarum prospero jactu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 17, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:15:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:66:15" default="NO">4, 66, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:17:1" default="NO">14, 17, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:354" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 354</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:475" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 2, 475</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 6, § 13 al.</bibl>; cf. Becker, Gallus, 3, p. 257 sq. (2d ed.).—</sense><sense id="n47956.2" n="II" level="1"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a square tablet on which the watchword was written</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a watchword</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">countersign</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tessera per castra a Livio consule data erat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:46:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 46, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 35, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:36:7" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 36, 7</bibl>; 9, 32, 4; Auct. B. Hisp. 36, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 6</bibl>: it bello tessera signum, <cb n="TEST" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:637" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 637</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:475" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 475</bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:17" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">missam ad se tesseram finxit redeundi,</quote> <trans><tr>a private token</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 30, 10, 3</bibl></cit>. — Hence, </sense><sense id="n47956.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the watchword</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signal</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">militem levi tesserā colligi posse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 7, 2 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n47956.4" n="III" level="1"> Tessera hospitalis, <hi rend="ital">a tally</hi>, <hi rend="ital">token</hi>, which was divided between two friends, in order that, by means of it, they or their descendants might always recognize each other (the Greek <foreign lang="greek">su/mbola</foreign>): <hi rend="ital">Ag.</hi> Ego sum ipsus, quem tu quaeris ... <hi rend="ital">Ha.</hi> Si ita est, tesseram conferre si vis hospitalem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 2, 87</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 2, 92</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">TESSERAM HOSPITALEM CVM EQ FECERVNT,</quote> <trans><tr>have entered into a bond of friendship</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1079</bibl></cit>; cf. Becker, Gallus, 2, p. 133 (2d ed.); <cit><quote lang="la">hence: hic apud nos jam confregisti tesseram,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>have broken our friendship</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n47956.5" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A square tablet</hi> or <hi rend="ital">block</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a checker</hi> for the construction of pavements, ornamenting garments, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 62, § 187</bibl> (al. tessella); <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:33" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 9, 36, § 62</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47956.6" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A token</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ticket</hi>, <hi rend="ital">billet</hi> for the distribution of corn or money: <cit><quote lang="la">frumentariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">frumenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:174" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 174</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:78:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 78, 10</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:40" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummariae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
tesserarius: <entryFree id="n47957" type="main" key="tesse^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tessĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tessera</etym>, <sense id="n47957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to</hi> tesserae. </sense><sense id="n47957.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <trans><tr>the art of dice-playing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">28, 4, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47957.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">tessĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n47957.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A dice-thrower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dice-player</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 624, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47957.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">He who receives and distributes the watchword from the commander</hi> (v. tessera, II.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3462</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3471</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3480</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
tesserula: <entryFree id="n47958" type="main" key="tesseru^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">tesserŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n47958.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little</hi> tessera. * </sense><sense id="n47958.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A square bit of stone</hi> for paving, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:149" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 44, 149</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n47958.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A votingtablet</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">a ballot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:18" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 18</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n47958.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small tally</hi> or <hi rend="ital">counter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:27:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 27, 5</bibl>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">a ticket</hi> for the distribution of corn, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:74" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 74</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47958.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A die</hi> used in play, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:13:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 13, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
testa: <entryFree id="n47959" type="main" key="testa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">testa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym> = tosta, from torreo</etym>, <sense id="n47959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a piece of burned clay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a brick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tile</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">o)/strakon.</foreign> </sense><sense id="n47959.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:23:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 23, 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18, 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:3:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Parent. 11, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n47959.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n47959.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A piece of baked earthen-ware</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an earthen pot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pitcher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jug</hi>, <hi rend="ital">urn</hi>, etc. (cf. testu): <cit><quote lang="la">si Prometheus ... a vicinis cum testā ambulans carbunculos corrogaret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct.
